Bitcoin industry 'sceptical' of Satoshi.description: Scepticism has greeted claims by Australian entrepreneur Craig Wright's claim to be the mysterious creator of the digital currency.

Vimeo buys video streaming rival VHX.description: Vimeo will let video-makers set up their own subscription video streaming services similar to Amazon and Netflix, the firm announces.

Yahoo chief's $55m severance package.description: Yahoo boss Marissa Mayer will get $54.9m (£37.4m) in severance pay if she loses her job when the troubled internet firm is sold.

Death sparks probe into China's Baidu.description: Chinese regulators are investigating Baidu following the death of a student after treatment at a facility advertised on the search engine.

Court expands FBI hacking powers.description: The US Supreme Court approves a rule change that could allow law enforcement to remotely search computers located anywhere in the US, and beyond.

Microsoft banishes Google from Cortana.description: Microsoft begins forcing people to use its Bing search engine with the Cortana digital assistant in Windows 10.

Hackers hit Minecraft community site.description: Hackers have stolen login data for more than 7 million members of the Lifeboat Minecraft site.

Carl Icahn dumps Apple shares on China.description: Billionaire investor Carl Icahn unloads his shares in Apple over the company's prospects in China.

Man jailed for failing to decrypt data.description: A man is held in prison for seven months after failing to decrypt two hard drives that investigators suspect contain indecent images of children.

Amazon rapped for illegal app charges.description: Amazon illegally charged parents for in-app purchases made by children, a US judge rules.

Computer viruses infect nuclear plant.description: A German nuclear power plant has been found to be infected by several different computer viruses.

Superfast broadband take-up 'slow'.description: Tests on 42 towns and cities across the UK suggest almost half have average broadband speeds below 24Mbps.
